channel.title: Portforwarding Issues
channel.description:
So.. I've port-forwarded a thousand times. I'm trying to do it again for exact same way I've done those previous thousand times and nothing is working.
I've;
[ul][li]Disabled firewall on router.[/li] [li]Added the port to my router.[/li] [li]Allowed the port through my firewall.[/li] [li]Restarted Router.[/li] [li]Checked port is open.[/li][/ul]
-- Anything I'm forgetting?
Still [b]not[/b] open...

item.title: Portforwarding Issues
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:551370”]Turn the application on that you’re forwarding?

Not all programs (Example: http://canyouseeme.org ) will pick up that your port is open unless you actually have a program using that port.[/quote]
Herp. Forgot about that, and of course that was the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Issues
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Turn the application on that you’re forwarding?

Not all programs (Example: http://canyouseeme.org ) will pick up that your port is open unless you actually have a program using that port.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Issues
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Port forwarding it under the correct local IP address.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Issues
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

So… I’ve port-forwarded a thousand times. I’m trying to do it again for exact same way I’ve done those previous thousand times and nothing is working.

I’ve;

[ul][li]Disabled firewall on router.[/li]
[li]Added the port to my router.[/li]
[li]Allowed the port through my firewall.[/li]
[li]Restarted Router.[/li]
[li]Checked port is open.[/li][/ul]

– Anything I’m forgetting?

Still not open…

Read full topic
